info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 5:44PM EDT until August 03 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Hart County in northeastern Georgia... South central Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... Central Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 543 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Abbeville, or 6 miles east of Lake Secession, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Homeland Park, Iva, Lake Secession, Starr, Lowndesville, Anderson Airport, Antreville, Rock Branch, Due West and Nuberg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
